docs.lead_paragraph: A city program to provide heroin to drug addicts undergoing rehabilitation has been proposed to Mayor Lindsay by his Narcotics Control Council after strong disagreement within the council over the controversial idea.

headline.main: REPORT ASKS CITY TO SUPPLY HEROIN FOR CONTROL PLAN; Maintenance Project Would Involve 500 Drug Addicts for a Year-Long Study A HEROIN PROGRAM IS URGED FOR CITY

docs.abstract: NYC Narcotics Control Council proposes to Lindsay that city begin program to provide heroin to drug addicts undergoing rehabilitation; confidential rept, acquired by NY Times, urges Lindsay to set up strictly controlled experimental program in which heroin, rather than methadone, would be administered to limited number of addicts as part of research study in rehabilitation of addicts; experiment, which is planned to last for 1 yr, would use no more than 500 addicts and would compare heroin maintenance with other techniques; proposal detailed; council members comment
